properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 30 at 9:09AM AKST until January 31 at 9:15AM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Juneau has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
Rain and Snowmelt... Around Ward Lake in Ketchikan...

* Until 915 AM AKST Friday.

* At 909 AM AKST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain and
snowmelt causing minor flooding around Ward Lake with trails and
the campground flooded. 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the
last 12 hours with warm temperatures causing snow melt at lower
elevations. Additional rainfall of around a quarter of an inch is
expected over the area through the next 24 hours.

Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local
weather news source for updates on this situation.
properties.instruction:
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where
you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become
killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or
creeks.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
